title: Arianespace and OneWeb reach settlement for suspended launches
summary: Arianespace said Sept. 13 it has reached a settlement deal that could revive a launch services agreement with OneWeb that was suspended following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: NASA Announces Pending Departure of Science Associate Administrator
summary: Dr. Thomas Zurbuchen, associate administrator of NASA’s Science Mission Directorate, will leave the agency at the end of 2022, after six years of dedicated service.

title: China launches Zhongxing-1E military communications satellite
summary: China launched a Long March 7A rocket Tuesday, successfully inserting the Zhongxing-1E satellite into geosynchronous transfer orbit.

title: As summer turns to fall, ULA still waiting for its BE-4 rocket engines
summary: "Why, Mr. Spock, you almost make me believe in miracles."

title: Competition is growing in the space-data-relay sector
summary: Companies reveal plans for optical and RF data relay networks to address growing demand from satellite operators for high-speed data transfer.
